description.value: Logical Model: The catalog is the set of IVD testing services offered by a clinical lab organization.

name.value: Mapping to IHE Laboratory Code Sets Distribution
Logical Model to FHIR Structure mappings

definition.value: The catalog is the set of IVD testing services offered by a clinical lab organization.

comments.value: This level could be represented by a resource referencing all the DataElements describing lab IVD testing services? Or the catalog could be represented only by the common root to the urls of the testing services resources?

map.value: LabTestCatalog-->Bundle.root {|} Rule: .type = "collection". (EH 9/2016 Comment: Also consider Document for publishing or ActivityDefinition here as well ( could bundle contain link to a pdf?))

definition.value: Bundle or List Resource -Catalog metadata.

map.value: MSH-4 Sending Facility eH : not always the same

map.value: LCSD overloads MFI-2 to add this item

comments.value: maps to base class Resource.language.

map.value: LCSD overloads MFI-2 to add this item

definition.value: Bundle or List Resource -Catalog metadata.

comments.value: In the shared repository paradigm, version & date are not really needed at the catalog level. Needed on DataElement.

map.value: LCSD overloads MFI-2 to add this item
LabTestCatalog.version-->Bundle.meta.versionId {|} Rule: . (EH 9/2016 Comment: part of inherited resource class)

definition.value: Bundle or List Resource -Catalog metadata.

map.value: LabTestCatalog.updateDate-->Bundle.meta.lastUpdated {|} Rule: . (EH 9/2016 Comment: part of inherited resource class)

definition.value: Item in catalog
The order in which the entry should be displayed. This is a bit of control metada

comments.value: EH: needed to preserve order, Use case for consistent human display , unless choose some other mechanism to group or order like alphabetical.This is very simple and need to look at existing catalog models to see other ways to do this

map.value: LabTestCatalog.entry.sequence-->ActivityDefinition.extension type=decimal 0.1 {|} Rule: . (EH 9/2016 Comment: I added this is a feature of composition and likely needed for catalogs)

definition.value: date/time for any change. This is a bit of control metada

map.value: LabTestCatalog.entry.updateDate-->ActivityDefinition.lastReviewDate 0..1 {|} Rule: . (EH 9/2016 Comment: There are more of these content independent DEs (like identifiers) that are in AD )

definition.value: effective date/time of change.

comments.value: change that breaks compatibility with previous results.

definition.value: The producer's usual or preferred identification of the test or observation and all alias codes/identifiers for this observation

comments.value: OM1-7 maps to OM1.2 ine dos and is likely going to be a LOINC codes see http://healthedatainc.com/go-ftp/publish/dataelement-labtestmaster-example.html.

map.value: LabTestCatalog.entry.code-->ActivityDefinition|DiagnosticRequest|DiagnosticReport|Observation.code 1..1 {|} Rule: . (EH 9/2016 Comment: THIS WILL be shared among the many resulting profiles ( Obs, DR, DR, QR))

definition.value: The producer's preferred name of the test or observation

map.value: LabTestCatalog.entry.name-->ActivityDefinition.title 1..1 {|} Rule: . (EH 9/2016 Comment: How is this different from Display neme see below? )

definition.value: the name that can be used in space-limited reports (e.g., specimen labels) to identify the observation for the convenience of human readers. The name can contain up to eight characters.

comments.value: EH: is this needed?

map.value: ineDOS only one of these is required EH: map to DE, DR, DO, OBS

definition.value: the fully-specified name for the observation or battery. It may include the full (unabbreviated) multiple-word names and contain up to xxx characters. It should be as scientifically precise as possible..

comments.value: EH:is this needed?

map.value: ineDOS only one of these is required, EH: map to DE, DR, DO, OBS

definition.value: This field contains any test aliases or synonyms for the name in the context of the ordering service.

map.value: not used by edos(LCSD relies on 2.5.1,eDOS on 2.8.2)

definition.value: This field indicates whether or not a service/test/observation is an orderable code. For example, blood differential count is usually an orderable test, MCV, contained within the differential count, is usually not independently orderable

This field indicates whether the definition entry identifies a test battery, an entire functional procedure or study, a single test value (observation), multiple test batteries or functional procedures as an orderable unit (profile), or a single test value (observation) calculated from other independent observations

comments.value: see HL70174 value set eH: this may be obvious if have reference to other catalog items and not needed.

definition.value: A text description of this observation.

the diagnostic studies/tests that are performed only at certain times during the course of a work day or work week. This field indicates the maximum interval between successive test performances (the test may actually be performed more frequently)

comments.value: example: "Monday, Wednesday".

map.value: LabTestCatalog.entry.schedule-->ActivityDefinition.extension type=Timing 0.1 {|} Rule: . (EH 9/2016 Comment: This is different than AD timing element)

definition.value: This test should be a specific event with no other tests to be performed with this test.If not populated, The default value of 'N' is assumed and that this test can be included with any number of other tests. When D is specified for this field, using element 'category' to 'determines how tests must be grouped together. Tests within the same Diagnostic Service Sector may be on the same requisition,

map.value: LabTestCatalog.entry.OrderAlone-->ActivityDefinition.extension type=bool 0.1 {|} Rule: . (EH 9/2016 Comment: part of DR profile too)

definition.value: The section of the diagnostic service where the observation was performed

comments.value: example: MCB: mycobacteriology.

map.value: LabTestCatalog.entry.category-->ActivityDefinition.extension type=code 0.1 {|} Rule: . (EH 9/2016 Comment: service category for grouping)

definition.value: Certain tests or observations require special patient preparation, diet, or medications. For example a GI contrast studies, this element would contain the pretest diet, e.g., low residue for two days, NPO before study, and the preferred purgatives.

comments.value: example: "patient fasting for at least 12 hours".

definition.value: The clinical information about interpreting test results. Examples are the medications that may cause false abnormals, and the information about the sensitivity and specificity of the test for diagnoses.

description of the foods, diagnoses, drugs, or other conditions that may influence the interpretation of the observation. Information about the direction of the effect, and any recommendation about altering the diet, conditions, or drug before initiating the test observation.

The diagnosis or problem for which the test is a contraindication or of possible danger (e.g., pacemaker, pregnancy, diabetes). For example, if the test identified was an intravenous pyelogram, this field would include warnings about the use of contrast media in diabetes
Should any prior results be sent with the Order. Example: "send the prior results of CBC in past 60 days".

map.value: Should this be a reference to DR?
LabTestCatalog.entry.priorResults-->ActivityDefinition.extension type=string 0.1 {|} Rule: . (EH 9/2016 Comment: should this be bool?)

definition.value: Other instructions to Order placer. For example: "Please include tentative diagnosis/treatment".
These elements describe the appropriate patients characteristic needed for the test For example species
Code to indicate that this service can only be ordered for this gender For example a Pap Smear

map.value: (LCSD relies on 2.5.1,eDOS on 2.8.2) EH could be a Patient Profile

definition.value: this service can only be ordered for these age ranges.

map.value: (LCSD relies on 2.5.1,eDOS on 2.8.2) EH could be a Patient Profile

definition.value: The typical processing time for single test/observation.Can in mins, hrs, days,,,

short.value: Test/Observations Included within an Ordered Test Battery

definition.value: This element references the entries that of all tests/observations included within a single battery a single functional procedure or a given superset

map.value: (LCSD relies on 2.5.1,eDOS on 2.8.2) EH could be a DiagnosticeReport Profile

definition.value: potential reflex tests.
rules triggering reflex tests.
These element describe the report metadata

any test aliases or synonyms for the name in the context of the ordering service. These are alternative names, not associated with a particular coding system, by which the battery, test, or observation (e.g., measurement, test, diagnostic study, treatment, etc.) is known to users of the system

comments.value: .alias maps to OM1-51.

map.value: ineDOS only one of these is required EH: map to DR

LabTestCatalog.entry.report.displayName-->DiagnosticRequest|DiagnosticReport|Observation.code.text {|} Rule: use in Obs if atomic test name. (EH 9/2016 Comment: This along with mapping code above identifies the DR/ Obs depends on whether panel or not)

definition.value: Defines the preferred header under which this observation should be listed on a standard display. For example, if the test is hemoglobin, this string might be 'Complete blood count.' It is represented as a coded data type so that a battery can be a header. Only the description part of the string may be included in case the subheader does not have an associated code. When a series of observations is displayed according to the sort order given below, the subheader that groups those observations is presented whenever the subheader changes.

map.value: LabTestCatalog.entry.report.subheading-->DiagnosticReport.extension type Reference(DiagnosticRequest) 0..* {|} Rule: . (EH 9/2016 Comment: extension.valueReference.display, asume only used in reports not obs)

definition.value: Defines the sort order in which this observation is presented in a standard report or display that contains the many observations.

map.value: LabTestCatalog.entry.report.displayOrder-->DiagnosticReport.extension {|} Rule: . (EH 9/2016 Comment: This is more like a composition concept instead of DR - discuss)

definition.value: These element describe the measurement metadata
The method(s) used to produce the observation. More than one method may be listed, but only if they produce results that are clinically indistinguishable.
The allowed data types for a single categorical observation

map.value: LabTestCatalog.entry.measurement.datatypes-->Observation.(value type) {|} Rule: . (EH 9/2016 Comment: not sure how to map this)

short.value: value set for valid coded answers

definition.value: list of valid coded answers. In the case that the list of coded answers is easily enumerated, list the valid coded answers for this observation here using the preferred coding system
Certain observations/tests have text (alpha) results (e.g., reactive, nonreactive). Alpha normals for those tests should be entered in this field (e.g., 'nonreactive').

comments.value: Need an attribute in ValueSet resource to qualify the value set (normal, abnormal, or critical answers). Could we use ValueSet.useContext for this purpose?

map.value: LabTestCatalog.entry.measurement.Normals-->Observation.referenceRange.text {|} Rule: Observation.referenceRange.meaning = "normal". (EH 9/2016 Comment: for nowlist in the ref range text element - future add extension for Valueset)

definition.value: The list of the text answers that are abnormal for the test.

map.value: LabTestCatalog.entry.measurement.Abnormals-->Observation.referenceRange.text {|} Rule: Observation.referenceRange.meaning = "abnormal". (EH 9/2016 Comment: for nowlist in the ref range text element - future add extension for Valueset)

definition.value: the list of coded results that are critically abnormal for this observation.
For single tests/observations that have numeric values. This field contains their customary units of measure
This field contains the single tests/observations - the corresponding UCUM units when these differ from the customary units of measure given in the previous field
This is a factor for converting the customary units to UCUM units.

For numerically valued single observations specifies the total length in characters of the field needed to display the observation, and the number of digits displayed to the right of the decimal point. This is coded as a single number in the format <length>.<decimal-digits>. For example, a value of 6.2 implies 6 characters total (including the sign and decimal point) with 2 digits after the decimal point. For integer values, the period and <decimal-digits> portion may be omitted (that is, 5.0 and 5 are equivalent). More than one such mask may be transmitted (separated by repeat delimiters) when it is necessary to define multiple display formats that are possible.

comments.value: as part of decimal type.

definition.value: the reference (normal) ranges for 'numeric' observations/tests

comments.value: criteria include sex, age, gestational age, species, raceeH; Use ReferenceRangeelement from Observation.

definition.value: When a critical range is defined for such observations, it should be recorded here in the same format as the normal range .
Results outside this range are not possible. The field should be recorded in the same format as the normal and critical ranges. .

This field uniquely identifies the service producing the observation described in this segment. Three components should be included: an identifying code, the name of the producer, and the identity of the coding system (e.g., 323-5678^Acme Special Lab^MC). The identity of the coding system will usually be MC (Medicare provider number or HIBCC site codes) in the United States. Each country may want to specify its preferred coding system and define a coding system ID to identify it.

comments.value: service producer is distinct from DataElement.publisher.

definition.value: the list of variables that the diagnostic service needs to interpret the results of an ordered study For example - age, sex.

comments.value: service producer is distinct from DataElement.publisher.

definition.value: code that the define the data elements the diagnostic service needs to interpret the results of an ordered study.

comments.value: see Questionnaire.

short.value: asked at orderentry or at specimen collection time?

definition.value: When in the ordering process or workflow this information must be collected.

comments.value: Should we use .element.requirements for this purpose? Or .element.constraint?eH; NO.

definition.value: Must the question be answered,

comments.value: EH: property of reference resource e.g. DataElement or Questionnaire or Observation.

definition.value: Guidance to the provider on how to answer the question.

comments.value: EH: property of reference resource e.g. DataElement or Questionnaire or Observation.

definition.value: This field contains the allowed datatype for answers, Type of answers include: numeric, date, coded, text, etc

comments.value: EH: property of reference resource Questionnaire

definition.value: Indicates if multiple answers are allowed, .

comments.value: EH: property of reference resource e.g. DataElement or Questionnaire or Observation.

definition.value: Allowed coded answers to be sent and/or display Text for Ordering system to present to provider.

comments.value: EH: property of reference resource e.g. DataElement or Questionnaire or Observation.

definition.value: Total number of characters allowed. Required for numeric and (long) text answers.

comments.value: EH: property of reference resource e.g. DataElement or Questionnaire or Observation.

definition.value: For numeric answers the number of digits after the decimal.

comments.value: EH: property of reference resource e.g. DataElement or Questionnaire or Observation.

definition.value: Observations/batteries that require a specimen for their performance. This element can be a coded concept or a reference to the Specimen Resource. This element may repeat when an observation or battery requires multiple specimens for their performance (e.g., creatinine clearance requires a 24-hour urine specimen and a serum specimen).

This specimen can be a coded concept or a reference to the Specimen Resource. This element may repeat when an observation or battery requires multiple specimens for their performance (e.g., creatinine clearance requires a 24-hour urine specimen and a serum specimen)
These elemente represent the specimen container elements.

the physical appearance, including color of tube tops, shape, and material composition (e.g., red-top glass tube). Note that the color is not necessarily a unique identifier of the additive and/or use of the tube. This is especially true for black and some blue tube tops, as can be seen above. Color is included here for user convenience.
the capacity of the container.
preferred a types of containers.
specimen additive.

the normal specimen volume required by the lab. This is the amount used by the normal methods and provides enough specimens to repeat the procedure at least once if needed. The default unit is milliliters (ml).
the amount of specimen needed by the most specimen sparing method (e.g., using micro techniques). The minimum amount allows for only one determination. The default unit is milliliters (ml).
other requirements for specimen delivery and special handling (e.g., delivery within one hour, iced).
This describes how the specimen and/or container need to be handled from the time of collection through the initiation of testing.
Whether the Specimen is the preferred or alternate for collection of the specimen

TheseElements are for identifying anything which is charged to patient accounts, including procedures, services, supplies. It is intended to be used to maintain a list of valid chargeable utilization items. Its purpose is to keep billing codes synchronized between HIS, Patient Accounting, and other departmental systems
text abbreviations or code that is associated with this charge

comments.value: part of codeableConcept.

definition.value: the full text description of this charge

comments.value: part of codeableConcept.

definition.value: The procedure code(s) for procedure, if any, associated with this charge description. Different procedure coding systems such as CPT4, ASTM, ICD9. are represented by coding translations.
The price to be charged for service, item, or procedure.
These elements contains per insurance company (payer) the policies specific to their organization. E.g. 'Limited Coverage Policy or the Approved Coverage Policy'.
A unique identifier for the insurance plan.
unique identifiers for the insurance company
Specifies the lowest and highest price for the Universal Service that needs to be disclosed on the payer notification to the patient (for example Medicare ABN).

comments.value: This should be a pair of elements with Money datatype. Check out other FI resources

definition.value: Specifies the reason for the interval between the lowest and the highest price for the Universal Service, for example additional testing (reflex test) that is added based on values of the initial test
These elements define the Diagnosis and Procedure that impact coverage requirements.
The code assigned to this diagnosis
The procedure code for procedure, if any, associated with this charge description. Different procedure coding systems such as CPT4, ASTM, ICD9. are represented by coding translations.
